subprocess_flow.description: Development teams dedicate time to explore new technologies relevant to the program's architectural runway and future product capabilities. This involves researching emerging trends, evaluating potential tools and frameworks, and conducting proof-of-concept experiments to assess their feasibility and value. The goal is to identify technologies that can enhance the program's ability to deliver innovative solutions and improve its overall technical agility.
success_criteria: Relevant new technologies are identified and evaluated.
Proof-of-concept prototypes demonstrate the feasibility of selected technologies.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Identify and evaluate new technologies for potential adoption within the program.
end_conditions: Technology evaluation reports and proof-of-concept prototypes are completed.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Conduct thorough evaluations and involve system architects in the decision-making process.

subprocess_flow.description: Teams engage in experimentation and prototyping to explore new ideas and validate potential solutions. This involves creating rapid prototypes, conducting user testing, and gathering feedback to iterate on designs and refine concepts. The focus is on fostering a culture of experimentation and learning, where teams are empowered to take risks and explore unconventional approaches to problem-solving.
success_criteria: Innovation prototypes are created and tested with users.
User feedback is gathered and incorporated into prototype designs.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Explore new ideas and validate potential solutions through experimentation and prototyping.
end_conditions: Innovation prototypes are tested and user feedback is summarized.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Establish clear criteria for evaluating ideas and conduct regular reviews to assess progress.

subprocess_flow.description: Teams document their learning and share their knowledge with the broader organization. This involves creating learning summaries, conducting presentations, and participating in knowledge-sharing sessions. The goal is to disseminate insights gained during the IP Iteration and promote a culture of continuous learning and improvement across the program.
success_criteria: Learning summaries are created and shared with the organization.
Presentations are conducted to disseminate insights gained during the IP Iteration.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Disseminate insights gained during the IP Iteration and promote a culture of continuous learning.
end_conditions: Learning summaries and presentation materials are completed.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Establish clear guidelines for documenting learning and provide incentives for knowledge sharing.

subprocess_flow.description: Teams prepare for the upcoming PI Planning session by reviewing the program backlog, identifying dependencies, and estimating the effort required for each feature. This involves collaborating with product management and other stakeholders to refine the backlog and ensure that it is aligned with strategic objectives. The goal is to ensure that the PI Planning session is productive and efficient, and that teams are able to commit to realistic PI Objectives.
success_criteria: PI Planning inputs are created and shared with stakeholders.
Teams are prepared to commit to realistic PI Objectives.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Prepare for the upcoming PI Planning session and ensure that teams are able to commit to realistic PI Objectives.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Establish clear guidelines for PI Planning preparation and provide teams with the necessary resources and support.
